I'd highly recommend watching "The Andromeda Strain." It's a thrilling sci-fi movie from 1971 where top scientists work tirelessly to discover the source of a mysterious alien contagion that wiped out a small town. Starring actors like Paula Kelly, David Wayne, and Eric Christmas.

Another interesting pick would be "I Heart Huckabees," a thought-provoking comedy-drama from 2004. In this film, Dustin Hoffman and Lily Tomlin play a husband-and-wife team of existential detectives who help people solve their deepest life questions. Naomi Watts, Isabelle Huppert, and other renowned actors also star in the movie. Enjoy the journey of self-discovery!

While all the films you've mentioned are intriguing, let me highlight two that might align best with your preferences for Hindi language and historical context:

1. 'The Rise of Theodore Roosevelt' offers a captivating look at the formative years of the 26th President of the United States, exploring his transformation from a privileged New York politician to commander of the Rough Riders during the Spanish-American War.

2. 'A Dangerous Method' delves into the intense relationship between Carl Jung and Sigmund Freud, giving birth to psychoanalysis – a fascinating exploration of two pioneering minds in the field of psychology. Enjoy the stellar performances by Keira Knightley, Michael Fassbender, and Viggo Mortensen!
